name: Ehrhart's volume conjecture
rephrased: If a convex body has its center of mass at the origin and contains no other lattice points inside, then its volume must be at most \((n+1)^n / n!\).
implication_form: If a convex body has its barycenter at the origin and contains only the origin as an interior lattice point, then its volume is less than or equal to \((n+1)^n / n!\).
explained: Ehrhart's volume conjecture states that for an n-dimensional convex body K ⊂ ℝⁿ with its barycenter at the origin, if K contains no other lattice points besides the origin in its interior, then the volume of K must satisfy vol(K) ≤ (n+1)ⁿ / n!. This conjecture provides an upper bound on the volume under the specified conditions.
